title: The Ghosts Of Bern
opening: Bern surrendered with King Zephiel’s death. The great war that shook the lands of Elibe was over.
Roy continued to search for the Dark Priestess, suspecting that she was the Dark Dragon. Following the beam of light emitted by the Divine Weapons, Roy headed for the Dragon Temple.

However, waiting for Roy in front of the temple was General Brunnya, the one remaining Dragon Lord of Bern. She had rounded up Bern’s remaining troops and was waiting to attack Roy. Their pride was at stake.
A battle with the now dead Kingdom of Bern… Roy had a heavy heart at having to battle these “ghosts.”

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: Lord Jahn, here is Idunn. Please take care of her.

intro.speaker: Jahn
intro.line: What will you do, human?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: We will stay here and face the Etrurian Army one last time.

intro.speaker: Jahn
intro.line: Do you have enough troops?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: The Dragon Knights scattered around the continent have all returned under our cause.

intro.speaker: Jahn
intro.line: Do you have a chance of victory?

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ...Our chances of winning are slim. Still, we are the Bern Army, the strongest standing force on the continent. We shall at the very least show them our unbending will.

intro.speaker: Jahn
intro.line: Will... You humans take actions incomprehensible to us at times. Would your will raise your chances of winning? ...Very well, I suppose. We all have our methods of battle.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ...Have you spread my message?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes. Those who leave the army now will not be tried for deserting. Whether to fight or to leave is up to each his own.’ That was your message, General Brunnya.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: How many still remain with us?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Nearly all of the troops are saying that they wish to fight by your side.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: All? Our chances of victory are slim. I’m sure many of the troops have families waiting for them. They must not feel pressured to stay.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: We are knights of Bern, my lady. We have no intention of bowing our heads to Etruria.

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: ...I want you to expel those who are injured and those who have young children or aged parents. They must not stay here.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: But General Brunnya...

intro.speaker: Brunnya
intro.line: This is an order. Understood?

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: Master Roy, our troops are ready.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ...Did the messenger return?

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: Yes. ...As we suspected, the enemy has no intention of surrendering.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Did you make it clear that their safety would be guaranteed if they surrender?

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: Yes. But they said, ‘We appreciate your offer, but we will not surrender.'

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Why? Bern already officially surrendered...

intro.speaker: Elffin
intro.line: This person might understand...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess Guinevere...do you understand why?

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: Yes. ...Bern recognizes itself as being the strongest force in Elibe. Their pride would not allow them accept defeat without fighting.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Master Roy! The enemy is advancing!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: ! ...We have no choice. We must fight! Merlinus, send Princess Guinevere to the back lines...

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: No. I will stay here. I...must hear their calls. That is all that a...traitor like myself can do...

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: M-Master Karel! This will become a battlefield soon...

battle.speaker: Karel
battle.line: So I see. This place is not known to outsiders. I thought I could be free of warfare if I stayed here...

battle.speaker: Karel
battle.line: Please do not worry. I will protect the village.

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: Thank you! We have nothing to fear with the Sword Saint on our side.

battle.speaker: Karel
battle.line: I am just an ordinary swordsman. Rumors expand out of proportion with time, so they must not easily be trusted. ...But this battle seems to be bigger than I thought. Is my sister all right...?

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: I never knew you had a sister.

battle.speaker: Karel
battle.line: I haven’t seen her in years, but I heard a while ago that she had fallen ill. I can only hope that she is leading a peaceful life with her husband and daughter...

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Uncle!

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: That voice... Is it Fir? What are you doing here?

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: I never expected to find you here, either, Uncle.

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: After traveling around the continent, I decided to settle here. I thought I could train my sword skills peacefully in a quiet place like this...

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Uncle... I must tell you something. Mother...she...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: ...Died?

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Yes...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: ... So she didn’t survive the illness... I’m sorry. I wasn’t there when she needed me the most...

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: No...it’s all right.

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: But why are you here? You don’t seem like you have been searching for me just to say that.

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Yes. I’m fighting against Bern now.

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: You...joined the war?

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: I know that you don’t like getting caught up in conflicts like this. But I couldn’t help but try and do something for those people who are suffering because of the war. Uncle...was I wrong? Did I make a mistake? Is this not good for training my sword...?

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: No, you have not made any mistakes. The path you choose on your own is never wrong. In fact, I shall assist you from now on.

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Really!?

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: Yes. ...You are right. You have grown. The last time I saw you, you were still a toddler.

recruit-visit.speaker: Fir
recruit-visit.line: Uncle...

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: Karel!?

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: Bartre? What are you doing here?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: I am currently enlisted in the Etrurian Army. I didn’t expect to see you here...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: After traveling around the continent, I decided to settle here. I thought I could train my sword skills peacefully in a quiet place like this...

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: ...I must apologize...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: ...Is it about my sister?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: Yes... I tried my hardest, but...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: She didn’t survive...

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: I am truly sorry. My weakness couldn’t save her...

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: It is not your fault. I must apologize. I couldn’t be at her side when she needed me the most...

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: ...I must ask you for something.

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: What is that?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: I want this battle to end. I know you dislike warfare... But would you help us...?

recruit-visit.speaker: Karel
recruit-visit.line: ...I see. Yes, I will try my hardest.

recruit-visit.speaker: Bartre
recruit-visit.line: Thank you! We have nothing to fear with such a skilled swordsman on our side!

visit.speaker: Karel
visit.line: This village has none who would wish to fight. Please leave us in peace.

battle-talk.speaker: Karel
battle-talk.line: I am Karel. I hereby have decided to assist your army.

battle-talk.speaker: Roy
battle-talk.line: You’re the Sword Saint... I have heard of your skills. You are most welcome in our ranks.

boss.speaker: Brunnya
boss.line: Bern will not lose! Even if I fall, Bern will rise back up and fight again!

boss.speaker: Brunnya
boss.line: Your...Majesty... Finally...I can go...to your side...

boss.speaker: Brunnya
boss.line: Melady... So, you have chosen the path with Princess Guinevere. That is one way... But I have chosen my own path, as you yours. I must fight to defend it!

boss.speaker: Brunnya
boss.line: You are a knight of Bern? So, you have chosen the path with Princess Guinevere. That is one way... But I have chosen my own path, as you yours. I must fight to defend it!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: This is the Dragon Temple... The Dark Priestess is in here?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: We can count on that. But...something is bothering me...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: In one of the legends of the Scouring, it is said that the Dragon Temple holds the power of the Dragons.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: It is also said that the temple’s power protects the Dragon itself.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: This is just my estimate, but perhaps it means that the Dragons inside the temple have much greater power than those on the outside.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: So... Our tactics against the Dragons until now might not work?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Perhaps... However, if those worthy of using the Divine Weapons use them to their fullest potential, then we may have a chance.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...We have no other good ideas. All right. Then we’ll choose those who have the best skill to enter the temple.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Be careful who you choose. We might not be able to leave once we’re inside...
